intro: Freziera monteagudoi, commonly known as the Monteagudo freziera, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and usually white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Freziera monteagudoi is considered a species of conservation concern.
